siteMetadata.title: csnotehub
siteMetadata.subtitle: Tips for CS, IT, and CpE university students!

frontmatter.title: Reading and Writing Files
frontmatter.description: The fstream class in c++ enables us to input and output to a file stored on the disk. Similar to how iostream is used in console input/output, fstream can do the same but to files.

frontmatter.title: Switch Statements
frontmatter.description: Switch statements are an alternative to daisy-chaining if-else statements. It takes in a case variable then compares its value to predetermined cases then runs code depending on which cases match.

frontmatter.title: Do While Loop
frontmatter.description: The difference between while and do while is that the code inside the scope { } of the loop is ran first before evaluating the condition.

frontmatter.title: For Loop
frontmatter.description: For loops are best used when looping a pre-determined amount of times or until a condition is met through iteration. Syntax: for (declaration; condition; increment) { code }
